Class InputHandler

java.lang.Object
com.game.utils.InputHandler
public class InputHandler extends Object
Handles loading, saving, and managing player input configurations for a game.

Supports reading key bindings for two players from a properties file, converting them to KeyCode, providing getters/setters, resetting to defaults, and saving updated configurations.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    static class 
    InputHandler.PlayerControls
    Encapsulates the key controls for a single player.

    Constructs an InputHandler, loading configuration from file or falling back to default key bindings if loading fails.

  • Constructor Details

    • InputHandler

      public InputHandler()
      Constructs an InputHandler, loading configuration from file or falling back to default key bindings if loading fails.

  • Method Details

    • loadConfiguration

      public void loadConfiguration()
      Loads key bindings from the properties configuration file. If the file cannot be found or an error occurs, resets to default keys.

    • convertStringKeysToKeyCodes

      public void convertStringKeysToKeyCodes()
      Converts string representations of key names from the loaded properties into KeyCode objects. If a key is missing or invalid, sets the corresponding key to a default value.

    • stringToKeyCode

      public javafx.scene.input.KeyCode stringToKeyCode(String keyString)
      Converts a string representation of a key to a KeyCode. Supports special names like "space", "up", "down", "left", "right", and "control".
      Parameters:
      keyString - the string representation of the key
      Returns:
      the corresponding KeyCode, or null if the string is invalid or empty

    • getJ1Controls

      public InputHandler.PlayerControls getJ1Controls()
      Returns the controls for player 1.
      Returns:
      a PlayerControls object containing player 1's key bindings

    • getJ2Controls

      public InputHandler.PlayerControls getJ2Controls()
      Returns the controls for player 2.
      Returns:
      a PlayerControls object containing player 2's key bindings

    • setJ1Up

      public void setJ1Up(javafx.scene.input.KeyCode key)
      Sets the key used for Player 1's "move up" action.
      Parameters:
      key - the KeyCode to assign to Player 1's up control

    • setJ1Down

      public void setJ1Down(javafx.scene.input.KeyCode key)

    • resetToDefaults

      public void resetToDefaults()
      Resets all player keys to their default values.

    • saveSettings

      public void saveSettings()
      Saves the current key bindings to the configuration file. If saving fails, an error message is printed.
